intro: Mesembryanthemum serratum, commonly known as the serrated ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. It blooms during the cooler months, typically in spring or early summer. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
